intro: Pelecyphora sneedii, commonly known as the Sneed's pelecyphora, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
